newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS TUESDAY LARGELY STRONGER.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS TUESDAY LARGELY STRONGER.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar closed on Tuesday firmer on the U.S. unit, the mark and the rand but was quoted easier against pound sterling, said dealers.

The local currency was trading weaker against the U.S. dollar earlier in the day, in the aftermath of a big import payment that went out the previous day but later recovered on the back of some export receipts.
"As today progressed we saw one bank selling (foreign currency) in the interbank market and the Zimbabwe dollar appreciated on the back of that," one dealer said.

The local money finished Tuesday's sesssion firmer at 11.3000/3100 against the key U.S. dollar compared to Monday's 11.3060/3160. It also registered gains on the mark at 6.6500/6700 from 6.6730/6795 and was at 2.5200/5400 versus the rand from 2.5320/5360.
It however slipped against sterling to 18.4300/4500 from 18.2585/2860, tracking a softer U.S. dollar overseas.
